result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe F. Levezow

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant to reimburse costs for Witness

Defendant Joe F. Levezow in court.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders warrant quashed.
Statements by ADA Bolz re: bond.
Per Court - bond reinstated.
Court continues matter for PH w/2773 to be scheduled.

9:51 AM 
Defendant Joe F. Levezow not in court.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Statements from Court - State is present with a witness to proceed in the preliminary hearing. 
ADA requests warrant. 
9:53 AM Warrant issued. 
9:53 AM - Back on record. 
ADA requests repayment of witness fees. 
Court grants the State's request.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.

3:05 pm
Assistant District Attorney Kat Turner: Present. 
Defendant present.
Defendant questioned by the Court regarding counsel.
Court finds defendant is forfeiting right to counsel for today.
Bond continued.
PH - BR 1 to schedule
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joe F. Levezow in court. Assistant District Attorney Kat Turner: Present. 
Stmt. by the Court
Stmt. by def. retaining Atty. Johnson for representation
Stmt. by ADA
Court indicated that defendant is to appear at next date with attorney.
Bond Cont.
AIA 9/20/22 at 1:30 p.m. 2773
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:17 PM
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Defendant - present.
Def. has contacted SPD - but plans to retain Atty. Thomas Johnson.
Court continues matter.
AIA: 9/6/2022 at 1:30pm with 2773.
Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:50 PM Defendant Joe F. Levezow appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. A. Gelhar appeared via zoom today only on behalf of Defendant.
Stmt. by Att. Gelhar regarding today's appearance.
Stmt. ADA and Atty. Gelhar on Bond.
Court orders signature bond $2,500 with conditions see bond.
AIA 8/9/22 at 1:30 1970
